author: Shirley McWhorter

review: $35 Chromecast purchase cost.  $8/month Netflix subscription cost.  These trivial amounts get you a huge selection of movies, documentaries, and TV series, viewable all the time, on your TV, at your convenience.  Roku and AppleTV do more, but at a higher cost.  For $35, Chromecast is a no-brainer - you gotta have it.  The setup is something that any 8-year-old can do quickly and easily, but may be beyond the capabilities of your grandma.  Likewise the operation of the device.If you don't have Roku or AppleTV, get Chromecast.  If you're nervous about setup and/or operation, ask an 8-year-old to show you how to use it.  You'll thank me later.

review: Pros:Easy setupGreat to use with PC/ChromeGood picture with proper bandwidthCons:Not much use with tablet/smartphone yet outside of YouTube and Netflix... But that will likely changeI have a two monitor PC and when my wife gets home, I start streaming her favorite show on my PC and cast it to our downstairs TV and then put the tab in the background and all the music/sound for her show goes to the tv. Then I put that tab in the background and now I can. Goof around on the internet while she watches the chew and we don't have to pay for cable. Also works great with ESPN go if you want to watch the big game, downloaded movies, music, etc. I got 2 of them now.
